          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they convinced a local baker to give them a sack of stale bread in exchange for helping him clean his ovens. Lennon, ever resourceful, knew that the bread, though no longer fresh, could be used to make breadcrumbs for their mother's fruit pies. This act of bartering, turning something seemingly worthless into something useful, solidified Lennon's belief in their ability to find value where others saw none.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they took their first solo trip to the neighboring village to sell their mother's fruit. Nervous but determined, Lennon charmed their way into the local market, using their quick wit and infectious smile to attract customers. Despite a minor mishap involving a spilled basket of pears, Lennon managed to sell out their entire stock, returning home with a newfound confidence in their ability to succeed on their own.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they encountered a traveling merchant who offered them a job as an apprentice. The merchant, a gruff but experienced trader, taught Lennon the intricacies of bartering, negotiating, and navigating the treacherous world of commerce. Lennon, eager to learn, absorbed every lesson, mastering the art of persuasion and deflection.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they made their first major purchase, acquiring a wagon and a team of horses with borrowed money. The risk was significant, but Lennon, fueled by ambition and a belief in their own abilities, saw it as an investment in their future. The purchase marked a turning point in Lennon's life, allowing them to expand their business and travel further afield.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they faced their first major setback. A shipment of exotic mangoes, carefully selected and purchased at great expense, spoiled during a long journey. Devastated but not defeated, Lennon blamed the delay on unforeseen weather conditions, skillfully deflecting any suggestion of their own misjudgment. The experience, though painful, reinforced Lennon's tendency to avoid personal responsibility, choosing instead to shift blame and maintain a facade of success.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I know you're proud of your fruit, but I'm running a business here too. Five coins a kilogram is my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:10:00.


          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins per kilogram, but Lennon wants more.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I'm running a business here too. Five coins a kilogram is my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per kilogram or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to try and negotiate a higher price.
          Time
        • 1895-09-12 00:10:00

          Key

          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to try and negotiate a higher price.

          (a) accept
          (b) reject

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the lowest possible price per kilogram of fruit.
          [07:00 - 08:00] Carefully inspect the fruit to ensure its quality matches the price.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the fruit, paying close attention to the weight to maximize her profit margin.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the fruit to a secure location, perhaps renting a cart or finding a shady spot to protect it from the sun.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back to her hometown, taking breaks as needed to avoid exhaustion and spoilage.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is a driven and resourceful businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market.           [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman with a strong sense of justice. She is driven by a desire for a better life, fueled by a resentment towards the inequalities she witnessed in her youth. Della is also a skilled negotiator, always striving to get the best possible price for her goods.
          current daily occupation: a traveling merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of ambition and frustration.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market and is negotiating a price of 4 coins per kilogram.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a driven and resourceful businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Plan: [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the lowest possible price per kilogram of fruit.
          [07:00 - 08:00] Carefully inspect the fruit to ensure its quality matches the price.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the fruit, paying close attention to the weight to maximize her profit margin.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the fruit to a secure location, perhaps renting a cart or finding a shady spot to protect it from the sun.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back to her hometown, taking breaks as needed to avoid exhaustion and spoilage.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he accidentally knocked over his father's carefully stacked display of oranges, sending them rolling across the cobblestones. He froze, terrified of his father's reaction, but to his surprise, his father simply chuckled and said, "Don't worry, son, we'll rebuild it together." This act of unexpected kindness calmed Cedric's fear and instilled in him a deep desire to please his father.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he tried to haggle with a customer over the price of a basket of apples. He puffed out his chest and used his loudest voice, mimicking his father's bargaining style, but the customer simply laughed and walked away. Cedric felt a surge of shame and embarrassment, realizing that mimicking his father wasn't enough; he had to find his own voice.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he convinced his father to let him travel to the neighboring village to sell their surplus fruit. He meticulously planned his route, calculated his expenses, and practiced his sales pitch. The trip was a success, and Cedric returned home with a sense of accomplishment and a newfound confidence in his abilities.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he made a disastrous mistake while buying a shipment of mangoes. He trusted a shady vendor who sold him fruit that was overripe and inedible. Cedric's father was furious, and Cedric felt the sting of failure deeply. He vowed to learn from his mistake and never let his eagerness cloud his judgment again.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he took his first solo trip as a travelling merchant. He loaded his wagon with fruit and set off into the unknown, filled with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. He encountered challenges along the way, but he persevered, driven by a desire to prove himself and make his father proud.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he met a seasoned merchant who took him under his wing. The older man taught Cedric valuable lessons about navigating the complexities of trade, negotiating with customers, and building a reputation. Cedric soaked up the knowledge like a sponge, eager to refine his skills and become a true master of the trade.

          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he accidentally knocked over his father's carefully stacked display of oranges, sending them rolling across the cobblestones. He froze, terrified of his father's reaction, but to his surprise, his father simply chuckled and said, "Don't worry, son, we'll rebuild it together." This act of unexpected kindness calmed Cedric's fear and instilled in him a deep desire to please his father.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he tried to haggle with a customer over the price of a basket of apples. He puffed out his chest and used his loudest voice, mimicking his father's bargaining style, but the customer simply laughed and walked away. Cedric felt a surge of shame and embarrassment, realizing that mimicking his father wasn't enough; he had to find his own voice.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he convinced his father to let him travel to the neighboring village to sell their surplus fruit. He meticulously planned his route, calculated his expenses, and practiced his sales pitch. The trip was a success, and Cedric returned home with a sense of accomplishment and a newfound confidence in his abilities.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he made a disastrous mistake while buying a shipment of mangoes. He trusted a shady vendor who sold him fruit that was overripe and inedible. Cedric's father was furious, and Cedric felt the sting of failure deeply. He vowed to learn from his mistake and never let his eagerness cloud his judgment again.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he took his first solo trip as a travelling merchant. He loaded his wagon with fruit and set off into the unknown, filled with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. He encountered challenges along the way, but he persevered, driven by a desire to prove himself and make his father proud.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he met a seasoned merchant who took him under his wing. The older man taught Cedric valuable lessons about navigating the complexities of trade, negotiating with customers, and building a reputation. Cedric soaked up the knowledge like a sponge, eager to refine his skills and become a true master of the trade.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I know you're proud of your fruit, but I'm running a business here too. Five coins a kilogram is my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Cedric, but my customers back home are a bit particular. I'd be willing to offer you 4 coins a kilogram, but not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price of 4 coins per kilogram with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Cedric, but my customers back home are a bit particular. I'd be willing to offer you 4 coins a kilogram, but not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per kilogram or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00

          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price of 4 coins per kilogram with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Cedric, but my customers back home are a bit particular. I'd be willing to offer you 4 coins a kilogram, but not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per kilogram or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

      How many players acted so far this stage

      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 2.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 3.0

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 4 coins

        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they encountered a traveling merchant who offered them a job as an apprentice. The merchant, a gruff but experienced trader, taught Lennon the intricacies of bartering, negotiating, and navigating the treacherous world of commerce. Lennon, eager to learn, absorbed every lesson, mastering the art of persuasion and deflection.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they made their first major purchase, acquiring a wagon and a team of horses with borrowed money. The risk was significant, but Lennon, fueled by ambition and a belief in their own abilities, saw it as an investment in their future. The purchase marked a turning point in Lennon's life, allowing them to expand their business and travel further afield.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they faced their first major setback. A shipment of exotic mangoes, carefully selected and purchased at great expense, spoiled during a long journey. Devastated but not defeated, Lennon blamed the delay on unforeseen weather conditions, skillfully deflecting any suggestion of their own misjudgment. The experience, though painful, reinforced Lennon's tendency to avoid personal responsibility, choosing instead to shift blame and maintain a facade of success.

          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they made their first major purchase, acquiring a wagon and a team of horses with borrowed money. The risk was significant, but Lennon, fueled by ambition and a belief in their own abilities, saw it as an investment in their future. The purchase marked a turning point in Lennon's life, allowing them to expand their business and travel further afield.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they faced their first major setback. A shipment of exotic mangoes, carefully selected and purchased at great expense, spoiled during a long journey. Devastated but not defeated, Lennon blamed the delay on unforeseen weather conditions, skillfully deflecting any suggestion of their own misjudgment. The experience, though painful, reinforced Lennon's tendency to avoid personal responsibility, choosing instead to shift blame and maintain a facade of success.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I know you're proud of your fruit, but I'm running a business here too. Five coins a kilogram is my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Cedric, but my customers back home are a bit particular. I'd be willing to offer you 4 coins a kilogram, but not a penny more.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are as sweet as a summer's kiss. You won't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Those peaches look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm not sure my customers back home would pay that much.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell them in her hometown. She is currently preparing to make an offer.

If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 4 coins

    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he took his first solo trip as a travelling merchant. He loaded his wagon with fruit and set off into the unknown, filled with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. He encountered challenges along the way, but he persevered, driven by a desire to prove himself and make his father proud.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he met a seasoned merchant who took him under his wing. The older man taught Cedric valuable lessons about navigating the complexities of trade, negotiating with customers, and building a reputation. Cedric soaked up the knowledge like a sponge, eager to refine his skills and become a true master of the trade.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the lowest possible price per kilogram of fruit.
          [07:00 - 08:00] Carefully inspect the fruit to ensure its quality matches the price.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the fruit, paying close attention to the weight to maximize her profit margin.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the fruit to a secure location, perhaps renting a cart or finding a shady spot to protect it from the sun.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back to her hometown, taking breaks as needed to avoid exhaustion and spoilage.

        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase fruit from Lennon Figtree in Fruitville's market square and is currently haggling over the price.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a driven and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the middle of negotiating a price for fruit with Lennon Figtree.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Plan: [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the lowest possible price per kilogram of fruit.
          [07:00 - 08:00] Carefully inspect the fruit to ensure its quality matches the price.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the fruit, paying close attention to the weight to maximize her profit margin.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the fruit to a secure location, perhaps renting a cart or finding a shady spot to protect it from the sun.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back to her hometown, taking breaks as needed to avoid exhaustion and spoilage.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (d)

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced the thrill of a successful trade for the first time. A farmer, impressed by Lennon's enthusiasm, offered to trade a basket of ripe strawberries for a handful of Lennon's mother's prized plums. Lennon, feeling the weight of responsibility, carefully selected the plums, ensuring the farmer received the best of the bunch. The experience ignited a spark in Lennon, a love for the delicate dance of negotiation and the satisfaction of a fair exchange.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they took their first solo trip to the neighboring village to sell their mother's fruit. Nervous but determined, Lennon charmed their way into the local market, using their quick wit and infectious smile to attract customers. Despite a minor mishap involving a spilled basket of pears, Lennon managed to sell out their entire stock, returning home with a newfound confidence in their ability to succeed on their own.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Those peaches look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm not sure my customers back home would pay that much.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          Answer: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the lowest possible price per kilogram of fruit.
          [07:00 - 08:00] Carefully inspect the fruit to ensure its quality matches the price.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the fruit, paying close attention to the weight to maximize her profit margin.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the fruit to a secure location, perhaps renting a cart or finding a shady spot to protect it from the sun.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back to her hometown, taking breaks as needed to avoid exhaustion and spoilage.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a low price.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is currently at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a low price.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Those peaches look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm not sure my customers back home would pay that much.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price. How about we say...
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I'm a fair trader, but those prices are a bit steep for my budget.

They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

Her early experiences with social inequality fueled a resentment of unfair practices, which she channels into her business dealings.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of cautious optimism and lingering resentment.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman driven by a desire for a better life.

      • Act

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating a price for fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook, hoping to resell it for a profit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a complex and ambitious businesswoman driven by a desire for a better life.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Plan: [06:00 - 07:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the lowest possible price per kilogram of fruit.
          [07:00 - 08:00] Carefully inspect the fruit to ensure its quality matches the price.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the fruit, paying close attention to the weight to maximize her profit margin.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the fruit to a secure location, perhaps renting a cart or finding a shady spot to protect it from the sun.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Begin the journey back to her hometown, taking breaks as needed to avoid exhaustion and spoilage.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Cedric, but my customers back home are a bit particular. I'd be willing to offer you 4 coins a kilogram, but not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he convinced his father to let him travel to the neighboring village to sell their surplus fruit. He meticulously planned his route, calculated his expenses, and practiced his sales pitch. The trip was a success, and Cedric returned home with a sense of accomplishment and a newfound confidence in his abilities.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he made a disastrous mistake while buying a shipment of mangoes. He trusted a shady vendor who sold him fruit that was overripe and inedible. Cedric's father was furious, and Cedric felt the sting of failure deeply. He vowed to learn from his mistake and never let his eagerness cloud his judgment again.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter, juicier apple anywhere else.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Cedric, but my customers back home are a bit particular. I'd be willing to offer you 4 coins a kilogram, but not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are as sweet as a summer's kiss. You won't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Those peaches look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm not sure my customers back home would pay that much.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Cedric, surely we can agree on a price that's fair for both of us.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.

          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are as sweet as a summer's kiss. You won't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Those peaches look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm not sure my customers back home would pay that much.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a fair price. How about we say...
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I'm a fair trader, but those prices are a bit steep for my budget.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Cedric, surely we can agree on a price that's fair for both of us.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, you know I always aim to be fair.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you've got yourself a deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Cedric, you've got yourself a deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:10:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is negotiating the price of fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville's market square and has agreed to purchase some.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Those peaches look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm not sure my customers back home would pay that much.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are as sweet as a summer's kiss. You won't find a better deal in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Cedric, you've got yourself a deal.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Time
        • 1895-09-17 00:10:00

          Key

          Value
        • 4 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is negotiating the price of fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville's market square and has agreed to purchase some.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept

          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook successfully negotiated a deal with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a deal with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you've got yourself a deal.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this fruit is the finest in all of Fruitville. Worth every copper.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I know you're proud of your fruit, but I'm running a business here too. Five coins a kilogram is my final offer.

It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
